ygData.msgSnippet: Harm Touch ... Why not have it act like a life tap, hit them for X points we get X points in HP back? David ... From: Princess Xaera [mailto:xaera@hotmail.com]
ygData.messageBody:
Harm Touch ... Why not have it act like a life tap, hit them for X points we
get X points in HP back?

David

-----Original Message-----
From: Princess Xaera [mailto:xaera@...]
Sent: Monday, September 20, 1999 10:16 AM
To: shadowknight@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [shadowknight] Another suggestion


From: "Princess Xaera" <xaera@...>

I'm a DE SK myself. If a big brute of an Ogre SK can't cast a Damage shield
on himself, a Druid or Magician is going to cast one on him for him. If you
want to balance it in such a way to give Races in SK's a little more
variation, play off their str's and weaknesses. A DE SK has FAR more INT
then an Ogre or Trolls, so play off that. Even with REALLY high int a DE SK
doesn't have that much Mana, so other then faster skill increases it doesn't
pay off to be smarter.

On side gripe I have about ogres trolls vs DEs is the whole HIDE vs SLAM
issue. They eventually get to learn how to hide at level 35, so why don't
we get to learn some kind of should body check move (ie slam). This
generally doesn't do my damage anyways, and is just good good for
disruppting spells. I think a DE has a tad more agi then either of those
two and could easily do a double backflip and land on the casters head.
heheh.

From: "Tony Donatelli" <donatea@...>

> You are correct, the damage shields were far too powerful if put on a big
SK
> (ogre/troll). Your comments about Shadow Step are interesting.

Is it too powerful because of their low agility? They get hit a lot and so a
damage shield would be too effective? Is that it?

And just a quick poll of my own -- How many troll/ogre SKs do we have here?
I'm a dark elf, and I know Cro is a troll. What about the rest of you guys?

> Lifetap/spike/draw would be used near the end of a melee in a group --
you
> could use it as a quick heal to minimize downtime.
>
> And personally, it has always been my idea that an SK feeds off the life
> force of the weak, so after a fight walking around and sucking the life
out
> of gnolls and orcs sounds very in character...

True, but in a DUNGEON situation, where you WILL be after say level 30,
there aren't any gnolls or orcs just wandering around waiting to be
vampired. So the only things you could lifetap would be those mobs that
you're actually fighting. And then you get back into the pull-back-to-cast
tactic that so many of us despise. I'm still pushing for damage shields. :)

Dravith Vandre'i
